  {panel}

h3. Summary

The 'resolution' field is not indexed by JIRA when hidden. This has two main consequences in Service Desk reports:
# The 'resolved' series in reports, such as Created vs Resolved don't show issues in this case
# If an issue is resolved while the resolution is hidden, if we change it to 'show', these issues are not shown in report as resolved, unless system is re-indexed

h3. Environment
Version: 3.3.0-OD-1000.212.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an SD project
# Make resolution hidden in Fields Configuration
# Create tickets and resolve them
# Check Created vs Resolved reports
# Make resolution visible again 
# Check Created vs Resolved reports

h3. Expected Results
The resolve tickets show in report both in steps 4 and 6.

h3. Actual Results
Both won't show any resolved issues. 
 
h3. Notes
There's a similar bug [here|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-38224]. 

Notice that you resolve a ticket *before hiding the field*, hide it and show it again, the ticket will show once the field is not hidden. That's probably because it was indexed by resolution, since it was visible when the ticket was resolved.

On the other hand, if you resolve the ticket *while the field is hidden*, it won't show unless you run a re-index.

Also, re-indexing while the field is hidden is useless and may just remove the existing indices for tickets created before it was hidden.

h3.Workaround
If you need to see the field in reports:
# Make it visible again
# Lock JIRA and re-index
# Keep it visible (otherwise, the problem will occur again)
# If you don't want users to see/edit this field, simply remove it from screens (Created/View/Edit)
fields.summary: Hidden Resolution field is not shown in reports

h3. Summary

java.lang.RuntimeException: org.codehaus.jackson.JsonParseException: Unexpected character ('П' (code 1055 / 0x41f)): was expecting comma to separate OBJECT entries
 at [Source: java.io.StringReader@1b32752; line: 11, column: 373]

h3. Summary

The approver doesn't get any other notification than the one to approve the ticket even if they are also set as the request assignee and are watching the request as well.

Also after removing that user as the approver, still no notifications are sent to them.

 
h3. Environment

Reproduced on JIRA Cloud version: 1000.245.1

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce

*Case 1:*
 # In JIRA Service Desk create a service request that needs approval (e.g. purchase request)
 # Set the same user as approver, assignee and watcher
 # Add couple of comments to the request (internal and public)

*Case 2:*
 # In JIRA Service Desk create a service request that needs approval (e.g. purchase request)
 # Set the same user as assignee and watcher
 # Add couple of comments and see that you get the notifications for those comments
 # Add the same user as the approver for the request

 
h3. Expected Results

In both cases the expected result is that the user get notifications for all the comments and status changes

 
h3. Actual Results

*Case 1:*
 - The user only receives the notification that the request needs approval

*Case 2:*
 - The user receives the notifications up until step #3. Then, after getting the approval notification they stop getting any other notification

 
h3. Notes

If you approve the request, then removing the user as the approver does not fix the issue since the user is still set as the one that approved the request.

 
h3. Workaround

None at the moment.
fields.summary: Issue approver doesn't get any other notification than the one to approve the request, even if they are also Watcher and/or Assignee in JIRA Service Desk Cloud

h3. Summary

If we change the 'Default Language' to Spanish or German, whenever we create a Basic SD project or an IT Service Desk project, we get:

{code:java}This service desk project has configuration problems and may not work as expected.

h4. Summary
The "Execute as" option is no longer available for Incoming Authentication under OAuth.
 This is required in order to use the Knowledge base functionality between JIRA Service Desk and Confluence, without having to expose the knowledge base space to anonymous viewing.

This comment describes such functionality having become available, however this does not appear to be possible anymore in 5.10.x versions of Confluence.

h4. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set up an application link between JIRA (Service Desk 3.1.x) and Confluence 5.10.x
 # On Confluence end, navigate to the application link settings and change the incoming authentication.

h4. Expected Results
An "execute as" option should be available from the dropdown men

h4. Actual Results
The expected option is not available.

h4. Notes

This option is vital for users that have a Service Desk environment, and want to make use of the knowledge base functionality.
 In certain use cases, it is not possible to expose the content of the knowledge base publicly, which rules out the option to allow anonymous viewing of the space(s) in question.

The functionality has been confirmed to work with a 3.1.x Service Desk environment connected to a 5.9.x Confluence environment.
 As such, a customer upgrading to Confluence 5.10.x could potentially see knowledge base functionality break.
fields.summary: "Execute as" no longer available as an option for Incoming Authentication under OAuth

*Background*

1. We use JIRA and Service Desk.
 2. For each client we have an internal JIRA project and an external Service Desk project.
 3. JIRA issues and Service Desk requests display on an internal Kanban board.
 4. Both JIRA and Service Desk use matching workflow.

*Problem*

For our Service Desk projects, *designers* and *developers* are Service Desk Agents because the Service Team Member role is too restricted. Specifically, these internal staff members can't:

1. Update the Assignee field

*Workaround*

The workaround offered by Atlasssian support is to create a linked JIRA issue for each relevant Service Desk request. This is not acceptable as it creates duplicate issues and we will mess with time-tracking.

*Desire outcome*

Extend the Service Team Member permissions to include the following items:

1. Ability to update the assignee field
 2. Ability to transition an issue through a workflow

h2. Current Situation

When an image/attachments with the similar file name is being attached to a comment. The previous comment with inline image/attachments will be pointed to the latest updated image.

h2. Use Case

At a support/helpdesk environment, user does not have control over the mail client that the customers use. Which in most of the case, image/attachments are pasted directly to the body of the mail. Causing the default file naming to be identical. 

This has seriously crippled the usability of Service Desk as the old comments (with similar file name) no longer represents the state that it should be in. 

To add to the pain, the incoming mail is being deleted upon creation. That removed the reference to track back and it causes confusion especially on a long running case where 4-5 inline image is added. They can only rely on the time recorded when the issue is added to reference it back.

h2. Proposed Solution

To have the ability to configure the attachments to be appended with time stamp. There should be a toggle in project level so that user get to choose if this only applies to specific projects.

Also could consider wiki markup with a timestamp column, to place that information to point the attachment to the right one.

h3. Problem Definition
As an agent, I often need to reference different cases in my JIRA Service Desk issue to the customer. My general workflow is: 
# I have an 'original' issue with a customer, and want to link another.
# Locate the issue though the JIRA issue navigator. 
# Identify the affected issue, open it up and get the customer portal URL. 
# Copy this link, and then paste this into the original issue.

This is is not a seamless experience for the agent. It would be easier to just copy the link from the issue navigator, and paste it in. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Ideally, it would be good if JIRA just understood what permissions a user had and then direct the user accordingly if they are already logged in as a customer, but don't have JIRA access.

h3. Workaround 
As mentioned above additional steps to get the correct link. 
Another workaround would involve using Text Expansion software that can automatically convert text in one format to another based on a script.

Even at our fairly small company, it's surprisingly common for a user to sign up with their company email and use that to create cases in our Jira Service Desk web screens. Then at some point down the line their email address changes or they have multiple emails pointing to the same inbox.

Then, when we add a comment and they are notified, the notification goes to their original email (which they get), but when they respond, their email client sends the response using their new email address. When this happens Jira Service Desk create a new separate case.

It's difficult for us to track all the cases and comments and it's difficult for our customer to understand that they now have multiple Service Desk accounts and their issues are spread across the two.

What can be done about this? My thought is in a Service Desk account, allow us to specify alternate alias emails for that user. They wouldn't be used to send anything out, but would be allowed for incoming messages so they don't create a new issue each time they comment.

*Note* : This feature request is created as an extension to JRA-2169 since JIRA and JSD is using a different mail handler. It will be desirable to have this feature implemented for both JEPP and JIRA Mail Handler, hence the creation of this feature request ticket.

h2. Current Situation

When an image/attachments with the similar file name is being attached to a comment. The previous comment with inline image/attachments will be pointed to the latest updated image.

Notice - this applies also to attachments pasted directly from the clipboard (i.e. take a screen shot 1, then paste into the attachment area of the ticket, then take another screen shot and paste into the same area; while at first the thumbnails will look different, on hitting 'submit' button the thumbnails will change to show only 1 attachment)

h2. Use Case

At a support/helpdesk environment, user does not have control over the mail client that the customers use. Which in most of the case, image/attachments are pasted directly to the body of the mail or in the ticket on the customer portal, causing the default file naming to be identical (image.png) and this causes that all the previous thumbnails added will change to the latest image added with that name.

This has seriously crippled the usability of JIRA as the old comments (with similar file name) no longer represents the state that it should be in. 

To add to the pain, the incoming mail is being deleted upon creation. That removed the reference to track back and it causes confusion especially on a long running case where 4-5 inline image is added. They can only rely on the time recorded when the issue is added to reference it back.

h2. Proposed Solution

To have the ability to configure the attachments to be appended with time stamp, there should be a toggle in project level so that user get to choose if this only applies to specific projects or to generate a random name for each image pasted.
fields.summary: Provide the ability to append timestamps to attachment names to avoid image display problems when attachments have the same name

h4. +Scenario+

In some cases, new users log in JIRA for the first time and are presented with an Empty page, or other kinds of bad layouts. Since they're not yet familiar with JIRA interface, they may get confused as to what is going on.

Most probably this happens due to JIRA or Browser add-ons, but the first, unwanted impression to new users should be avoided.

h3. Problem Definition

Notifications to Service Desk Agents use JIRA's standard notifications which link to Issues using URLs like {{[http://jira_url/browse/PROJ-###]}}, and it's not possible to make changes to this specifically for Service Desk Agents.
h3. Suggested Solution

Introduce a way to customize the URL so Agents instead receive emails where the URL is of the format {{[http://jira_url/projects/PROJ/queues/##/PROJ-###]}}. Alternatively, simply make it so that notifications to Agents in for Service Desk issues use the queue link when queues are defined.

The goal here being that when an agent clicks on a link in their email they see the issue in the Queue view, when appropriate, rather than the more generic Issue browsing view.
h3. Possible Workaround

It may be possible to define a custom set of *Events*, associate those with a specially defined set of email Templates, and then update all related Workflow steps so that the custom event is used instead of the generic ones.

h3. Problem Definition
Currently in JSD the mail puller job and mail processor job is scheduled at the same time (noticed from {{clusteredjob}} table) this could lead to the result that the mail being pulled from mailbox will be processed in next cycle of processor job (which means get processed after 60 sec).

h3. Suggested Solution

h3. Summary
When the Application link between JIRA Service Desk and Confluence is configured to use OAuth (without impersonation) it makes all requests anonymously. This causes problems when creating an article from the panel (as well as from the "Create KB Article" button on older server versions of JIRA Service Desk).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Link a JIRA Service Desk instance with a Confluence instance and configure the link to use OAuth (without impersonation).
# Create a Service Desk project
# Create a link under Project Settings > Knowledge Base to a space on the Confluence instance in step 1
# Go to the issue view for any issue in the project
# Click the "create an article" link from the KB Panel or the "Create KB Article" button to open the dialog.
# Fill in the form and click "Create"

h3. Expected Results
The user is taken to the Confluence editor to create a page.

h3. Actual Results
There is a 404 error and the page shows "Page not found".

h3. Workaround
Create the page in the space directly from Confluence using the Create button in the header.

h3. Notes
If the user happens to be logged and already have a draft open then they will see the editor when clicking "Create". However upon attempting to save the page they will see a Null Pointer Exception.
fields.summary: Creating an article from the JIRA issue view does not work with OAuth (without impersonation)

When screenshots or images are included in a mail sent to JIRA ServiceDesk, by default they are *+attached as thumbnails+*

When multiple screenshots are included, it is an _annoyance_ having to click thru every one in order to see them properly. However, *if screenshots were included at full size*, then it becomes much easier to read the Description or Comments.

The only workaround we know of is having to edit the *Description* or *Comment*, in order to remove the {{"}}{{|thumbnail!"}} tag on JIRA markup language. The more images a mail has, the more time consuming is this.

We want to force JIRA to display all images in issue description to always display at full size. At least, there should be a* global parameter* to set up such preference. I did not find any option in the admin screen for that. 

How do we achieve this ? Please help !
